events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on highway I-95 involving their sedan and a truck.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the initial details mentioning a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the customer's auto accident claim and to communicate all necessary steps.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer, confirming we received their report of the car accident.
Requested the customer to submit the accident report, vehicle registration, and photos of the collision damage.
The customer provided all required documentation including police report and images of both damaged vehicles.
Investigation into the circumstances of the car accident began with review of submitted evidence and statements.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and the other party caused the vehicle collision.
A settlement offer was sent to the customer covering the repair costs and rental vehicle fees post-accident.
Customer responded positively, expressing gratitude for quick handling and clear communication regarding the settlement.
The claim was formally approved following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
Payment to cover vehicle repair and associated expenses was processed and issued to the customer promptly.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirming all payments and documents were finalized.
The claim files and correspondence were archived for record-keeping and compliance purposes at claim closure.
